greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Eighth convolution of A115140.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1670
formula: O.g.f.: 1/c(x)^8 = P(9, x) - x*P(8, x)*c(x) with the o.g.f. c(x):=(1-sqrt(1-4*x))/(2*x) of A000108 (Catalan numbers) and the polynomials P(n, x) defined in A115139. Here P(9, x)= 1-7*x+15*x^2-10*x^3+x^4 and P(8, x)=1-6*x+10*x^2-4*x^3.

a(n) = -C8(n-8), n>=8, with C8(n) = A003518(n+3) (eighth convolution of Catalan numbers). a(0)=1, a(1)=-8, a(2)=30, a(3)=-16, a(4)=2, a(5)=a(6)=a(7)=0. [1, -8, 20, -16, 2] is row n=8 of signed A034807 (signed Lucas polynomials). See A115149 and A034807 for comments.
program: (MAGMA) m:=30; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Rationals(), m); Coefficients(R!( (1-8*x+20*x^2-16*x^3+2*x^4 +(1-6*x+10*x^2-4*x^3)*Sqrt(1-4*x))/2 )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 12 2019
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 13 2006
